["Banana cue" in the Philippines is a snack made of deep fried bananas that are coated in caramelized brown sugar, and served skewered on a bamboo stick.]

In 2006, Nida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services, which she believed would help her to improve her business and living situation. She is currently requesting an amount of 13,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional bananas, sticks and other ingredients. In the future, Nida wants to build a house and to finish educating her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas, sticks, and other ingredients for making banana snacks to sell

loans.name: Jean Raul

texts.es:
Jean es un hombre de 22 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con sus padres y hermanos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tiene de trabajar, Jean no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Contabilidad que desea, en sus ratos libres le gusta hacer deporte y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Tallarines Verdes para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Jean trabaja como vigilante, brindando servicios de seguridad en un centro educativo de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Jean se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos para la compra de medicina y consultas medicas para su Abuelita, ya que ella se encuentra delicada de salud y Jean desea poder aliviar sus dolencias, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder estudiar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Jean is a 22 year-old man who is single and lives in the city of Pucallpa with his parents and siblings. He is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to excel. Unfortunately, due to lack of financial resources and the need to work, Jean has not been able to study for a career in Accounting, which is his wish. In his spare time he likes to do sport and sometimes cooks delicious Tallarines Verdes (green noodles - a south american dish) to share with his family.

On his own initiative, and with much effort and dedication, Jean works as a guard providing security services in an educational centre in his city. He works every day for approximately 12 hours and believes that he his doing well because of his good performance and the friendly service he provides.

Jean is very thankful to Kiva lenders, since with their help he will be able to pay the cost of medicines and medical consultations for his grandmother. She is in a delicate health and Jean wishes to be able to relieve her aches. He will continue to work and strive to achieve his dream of studying for a professional career.

loans.use: to pay for his grandmother's medical costs and consultations.

loans.name: Pheak's Group

texts.en:
Pheak, a mother of three schoolchildren, is a villager from Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She is 39 years old and a rice grower in the local area. After 10 years' involvement in the rice farming business, she is able to earn up to 10,000 KHR per day.

Pheak is on her fifth loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan already. The loan has supported her business on time. Now, she forms a group of five to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy potash and rice seed, and to pay for labor for her rice crop. Additionally, she will use a portion of the loan capital to buy pigs and pig feed, which she will use to earn extra income. She hopes to earn more income and to keep her kids in school until graduation.

loans.use: to buy potash and rice seed, and to pay for labor for her rice crop, and to buy pigs and pig feed

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Samart's Group

texts.en:
SamArt, 38 years old and married, is the father of three children. For eight years now he has been making a living via rice cultivation, while his wife works at a factory for extra income.

SamArt and his group partner are first-time borrowers with VisionFund, Kiva's partner. As the group leader, SamArt will spend his loan portion of 1,000,000 KHR to buy rice seed, three sacks of fertilizer, and insecticide for his farmland. He hopes to triple his crop output and increase his income for the sake of his family.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, three sacks of fertilizer, and insecticide for his farmland.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty, de 25 años, vive con su esposo Noe desde hace 5 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos de 8 y 3 años de edad respectivamente. Viven en su casa a medio construir y esperan muy pronto culminarla.Desde hace 4 años siembra papa (tubérculo), maíz y alverja; con la ayuda de su padre quien le enseño a cultivar la tierra y todo lo necesario de la actividad agrícola. Con las ganancias de la comercialización de los sacos de papa construyó la mitad de su vivienda, por lo que espera que esta próxima cosecha sea más productiva para ganar lo suficiente y concluir la otra mitad restante, para poder darles un hogar adecuado a sus hijos, quienes son el motivo que la impulsa para salir adelante en su sacrificada labor. Además cuenta que hace muy poco comenzó a trabajar como promotora de salud para el estado; detectando a los niños desnutridos de la localidad. Por lo que le pagan un dinero extra. Asimismo comparte sus actividades con la ganadería, cuidando de sus animales menores como: cerdos, burros y carneros, que luego de ensebarlos los llevan a comercializarlos en el mercado central de la ciudad. Betty en el futuro desea sembrar en mayor  cantidad e independizarse, además tiene planeado abrir una tienda de abarrotes que le ayude a obtener más ingresos económicos.Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Santa Cruz de Tapo”, y este es el cuarto crédito con KIVA, donde aprendido a ser responsable, por ello paga puntualmente sus cuotas. Betty, invertirá el dinero en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Betty is 25 years old and lives with her husband of five years, Noe.  They have two children, ages 8 and 3.  They live in their partially completed home and are hoping to finish it soon.  She has been raising potatoes for four years (tubers), also corn, and peas, with her father’s help.  He taught her to farm, work the land, and do all that is necessary for farming.  She built half of her house with the proceeds from the sale of her potatoes, and she expects the next harvest to be more productive and earn what she needs to build the other half.  She says that she began working a short time ago as a health promoter for the state, looking for malnourished children in her area.  She earns extra money.

She also raises livestock such as pigs, donkeys, and rams, which she later sells in the central market in town.  Betty would like to plant in greater quantity in the future so she can become independent.  She also plans to open a grocery store to help generate more financial resources.  She is a member of the “Santa Cruz de Tapo” communal bank and this will be her fourth Kiva loan, where she has shown to be responsible and pays on time.  Betty will use the money to buy compost to feed her crops.

loans.use: to buy compost.

loans.name: Zenon

texts.es: El Sr. Zenón  tiene 51 años,  tiene tres  hijos, el se dedica a la construcción de muebles,  tiene su carpintería que se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de la Paz  se dedica a esta actividad desde hace ya 20 años,  esta actividad lo aprendió de su padre quien también era carpintero,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Zenón  utilizara  este préstamo  para  la compra de madera para la construcción de muebles , su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital para la compra de este material de trabajo, ya que sin esto no podría realizar sus muebles,  el Sr. Sr. Zenón  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son salir de la pobreza  va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida, ya que esta es su única actividad que le permite mantenerse y mantener a su familia, por este motivo se siente feliz ya agradecido a la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Zenón is 51 years old. He has three children. He works making furniture and has a carpentry workshop located in the area of Tembladerani in the city of La Paz. He has been doing this work for twenty years, learning it from his father who was also a carpenter.

This is his first loan with the institution. Zenón will use the loan to buy wood to make furniture. His reason for asking for the loan is lack of capital to buy work supplies, because without it he can’t make his furniture.

Zenón faces challenges in his business such as getting out of poverty. He is going to use the profits to improve his quality of life as this is the only activity that allows him to maintain himself and his family, and this is why he  is happy and grateful to the institution for its support.

loans.use: to buy wood for his workshop so he can make furniture

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a married woman. She is 66 years old and has five children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

She owns and operates an agricultural business, planting and harvesting rice for sale. Aside from farming, she also manages her store, selling goods and school supplies in the community. 

Erlinda joined GDMPC in the year 2006. Now she is again requesting a loan, this time for 15,000 PHP, to purchase additional goods and school supplies for sale. In the future, she wants to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods and school supplies for sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe, in the Kampala East region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past two years, Mary has been working hard to manage her salon, where she does hair dressing. 

To help expand her business, Mary has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more hair care products for the salon, and will help Mary to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her young sister. Mary hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand the salon into a unisex salon. 

Mary is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.


"

loans.use: to buy more hair care products for the salon.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala East region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, with one of them currently in school. For the past three years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her clothing store.

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes to sell, and will help Sarah to generate greater profits and take care of her parents’ medical bills. Sarah hopes that in the future, she will be able to own a big shop that sells shoes. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sokry's Group

texts.en:
Sokry is a 27-year-old local farmer from the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, who is a breadwinner for her family, which includes a schoolchild. Her main source of income comes from working at the garment factory and growing paddy rice, which she has only been involved in for four months. Sokry has never worked with Kiva partner VisionFund before. 

In this group of three women, she is the leader. Sokry will spend her loan portion to pay for labor and buy fertilizer, rice seed, and insecticide for her farmland. She hopes that she can gain a high cash-crop yield and keep her child in school.

loans.use: to pay for labor and buy fertilizer, rice seed, and insecticide for her farmland.

loans.name: Seab's Group

texts.en:
Seab is a 48-year-old mother of seven children who lives in the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province. Nowadays, only four of her children are under her care as they are still in school. For the sake of her kids, she earns a living by working at a garment factory and also by rice cropping, which she has been involved in for 15 months. 

Seab, who has never been with Kiva partner VisionFund before, is the leader of a group of three. She will use her loan portion to build a decent latrine for her family. She hopes that this loan will provide a decent latrine for her family and help them promote their health.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine for her family.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio is 44 years old and married with one child. He lives in Aguada, Ozamiz City. He has a service-based business providing transportation services to the local community for a living.

He joined GDMPC in 2011 and he is now requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase a raincoat and other accessories so he can provide better services. He plans to procure another unit for expansion of his business.

loans.use: to purchase a raincoat and other accessories for better service

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.en:
Edgardo earns a living through his motorcycle transport business. He is a married man and has been in the business for more than 15 years now. Edgardo has two young children who are 4 years old and one year old. 

Edgardo is asking for a loan to pay for the repair and maintenance of his motorcycle and to buy fuel. With this, he will be able to serve more passengers and augment his daily income. Edgardo dreams of exploring other ventures to increase his income and he wants to save money for the future schooling of his children.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of his motorcycle and buy fuel.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman with two children who lives in Catadman, Ozamiz City in the Philippines. To make a living, she owns and manages a bakery making assorted breads and cakes for sale. She has been in this business for seven years. 

Last year, she joined GDMPC and gained access to microfinance services. Susan is requesting an amount of 35,000.00 to purchase raw ingredients and she plans to expand her business to create multiple incomes for the family.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for baking.

loans.name: Condrada

texts.en:
Condrada is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family and she has been in this business for four years now.

Condrada requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, spices, and vegetables for her food production business.

In the future, Condrada would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, spices, and vegetables for her food production business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 44 years old and married. Josephine works very hard to provide for them.

Josephine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like shampoo, sugar, noodles, biscuits, laundry soap, etc., in her general store.

Josephine has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, sugar, noodles, biscuits, laundry soap, etc. 

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like shampoo, sugar, noodles, biscuits, laundry soap, etc., in her general store

loans.name: Ronilo

texts.en:
Ronilo is a 29-year-old resident of Gata Daku, Clarin.  He helps his family meet its needs from the modest amount of 7,000 PHP that he gains monthly from his gardening business.

In order to purchase fertilizer such as manure for the plants to give a better harvest, he borrowed from GDMPC an amount of 15,500 PHP. He plans to cultivate the nearby lot to generate additional income from farming and give a better future for the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Som's Group

texts.en:
Som, 51, is a married mother of five children. She deals with the daily cost of living via working at a local garment factory, while her husband works at construction to supplement the family’s income. 

This is the first microloan for Som with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She formed a group of three to apply for a loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy a decent motorbike for her husband as the transportation for commuting back and forth to the workplace. 

She hopes that her husband can minimize the transportation cost that he used to cover and use the money to help the family instead.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike for her husband.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is from Segatic Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 42 years old, married, and has five children. To make a living, Felix buys and sells coconut shells. In addition to this, he also buys coconut for copra (dried coconut meat used to make oil) production for sale. 

Recently, he requested a loan of 12,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase more coconut for production. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase more coconut for production.

loans.name: Sreyneang's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a village located in Kampong Cham province, Sreyneang is 31 years old and has three children who are in school. She overcomes the financial burden in her family from one hectare of rice cultivation, in which she has been engaged for ten years. The current business has returned her almost 40,000 KHR per day. 

This is the first loan for Sreyneang’s group, consisting of two female members. They are seeking the same loan amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. 

As the leader, Sreyneang will spend her loan portion to buy potash and fragrant rice seed, and to pay for the plowing fee. She hopes that she can gain a high crop output and make more income.

loans.use: to buy potash and fragrant rice seed, and to pay for the plowing fee.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Chery

texts.en:
Chery is from Kinuman Norte, Ozamiz City. She is 27 years old and married with two children. Her husband is a carpenter. To help him, Chery cultivates and sells bananas. She requests a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer to use in growing bananas. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to use in growing bananas.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en: The young mother of one small child who lives in Kampong Cham province, Mom is a farmer who grows rice on a one hectare area as her main source of income. She has had this business for five years. Mom has never been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, before. She and her joint member are seeking a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes to grow her cash-crop fruitfully so that she can earn more income to sustain her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Sanelita

texts.en:
Sanelita is from Kinuman Norte, Ozamis City. She is 46 years old. Sanelita is married and has two children.To make a living, she plants and harvests corn for sale. She has been engaged in her business for five years and earns 5,000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In addition to these activities, she also plants bananas for sale. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. 

Sanelita plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure.

loans.name: Hermie

texts.en:
Hermie is a married woman who has four children. She is 58 years old and resides at Kinuman Norte, Ozamis City, Philippines. 

Hermie owns and operates a coconut farm for a living. She has been ten years in this business. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of business. Aside from doing this, she also raises piglets for sale. She requested a loan of 10,500 PHP to purchase feed and vitamins.

In the future, Hermie wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 58 years old, married and has six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Lucia has a furniture-making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials like wood, nails, etc. for her business.

Lucia has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like wood, nails, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Sros' Group

texts.en:
Sros is 30 years old and married, and she resides in a village of Sa Ang district, Kandal province, She has one dependent child. She earns a living by working at a factory. She has done this work for four years and is able to earn up to 16,700 KHR per day.

This is the seventh time that Sros has taken a loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Her previous loan, which she has fully repaid, enabled her to set aside some money to buy a decent motorbike, for commuting back and forth to the factory. It helped her very much, indeed, to reduce her transportation cost well below what she used to spend. Now Sros is seeking a new loan, which she will use to help her mother’s business, by buying potash and rice seed for her to use. Sros hopes that her mother will grow a fruitful cash crop on time, and make more income.

loans.use: To help her mother’s business, by buying potash and rice seed

loans.name: Las Orquideas Group

texts.es: El grupo “LAS ORQUIDEAS” está conformada por 11 socias trabajadoras cada una dedicada a diversas aéreas del comercio. Rosana tiene 37 años es conviviente con 4 hijos dependientes. Hace unos años implemento su bodega en su vivienda en donde ofrecer productos de primera necesidad en sus tiempos libres se dedica a vender productos de belleza. De esta manera a podido apoyar a su esposo con la educación y alimentación de sus hijos. El cual se dedica a la construcción. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de arroz azúcar y bebidas. Su mayor deseo es tener una librería y darles una buena educación a sus hijos. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo. Rosana es la segunda del lado izquierdo viste chompa negra y un polo plomo.
texts.en:
The Las Orquideas group is made up of 11 hardworking members who each work in different areas of business.  

Rosana is 37 years old, married, and has four children.  Many years ago, she started a small shop in her home where she offers necessity items.  In her free time, she sells beauty products.  This allows her to support her husband with the education and food for their children.  Her husband works in construction. She will use this loan to purchase rice, sugar, and drinks.  Her dream is to have a bookstore and give her children a good education.

The group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loan.  

Rosana is the second on the left side, dressed in a black sweater and gray shirt.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, and drinks.

loans.name: Nawume

texts.en:
Nawume is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe, in the Kampala East region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past two years, Nawume has been working hard to manage her retail shop, where she has been selling sugar, salt and bread. 

To help expand her business, Nawume has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities for her to resell, such as sugar, bread and cooking oil. The new inventory will help Nawume to generate greater profits and to save her profits for future use. Nawume hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand her business into a supermarket. 

Nawume is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities to resell at her shop, such as sugar, bread and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Belkis Valeria

texts.es:
Belkis,22 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de León , casada, madre de 1 hijo de 6 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de joyas de plata, acero y mercadería en general , ella estudia el 4 año de la carrera de Farmacia. 
Ella inicio vendiendo cosméticos por catálogo, las ganancias que obtenía las invirtió en compras de otros productos como joyas de acero y plata, después fue agregando la venta perfumes, artículos de cocina. Ella vende su mercadería al contado y al crédito la mayoría de sus clientes trabajan en empresas privadas y otras estudian con ella en la universidad. Desea graduarse de la carrera de Farmacia y tener un local en el centro de la ciudad para tener su negocio ahí. Actualmente está requiriendo el crédito para comprar joyas de plata y acero.
texts.en: Belkis lives in León.  She is 22 years old, married, and has a six year old son.  She sells silver and steel jewelry and general merchandise.  She is in her fourth year of study for a degree in pharmacy.  She began by selling cosmetics through catalogues and invested the profits in the purchase of other products such as steel and jewelry.  Later, she added perfumes and kitchen items.   She sells her merchandise on credit and cash.  Most of her customers work in private businesses and others study with her at the university.  She wants to graduate with a degree in pharmacy and establish a site for her business in the city center.  Currently, she is requesting the loan to purchase silver and steel jewelry.

loans.use: to purchase silver and steel jewelry.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge es un hombre de 41 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Nazca, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a sus padres, Jorge no pudo estudiar la carrera de Agronomía que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta distraerse viendo televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Escabeche de Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres, Jorge se dedica a la agricultura, el cuenta con una pequeña parcela donde siembra maíz, Jorge trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su experiencia y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Jorge se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos de riego, fertilización y cosecha de su cultivo, de esta manera Jorge podrá asegurar el adecuado crecimiento de su cultivo, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ampliar su cultivo.
texts.en:
Jorge is 41 years old, single, and lives in the city of Nazca.  He is a kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who dedicates all of his efforts to getting ahead.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources and the need to work since he was very young to help his parents, Jorge was not able to study agronomy like he wanted.  In his free time, he likes to watch television and sometimes cooks a rich dish of marinated chicken to share with his family.

By his own initiative, with a lot of effort and thanks to the things his parents taught him, Jorge works in farming.  He has a small piece of land where he plants corn.  Jorge works every day for about 10 hours and he believes that it is going well because of his experience and the kind treatment he provides to everyone.

Jorge is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their support, he will be able to cover the costs of irrigation, fertilization, and planting of his crop.  In this way, Jorge will be able to assure the adequate growth of his crop so that he can continue working and making an effort in order to achieve his goal of expanding his crop.

loans.use: to cover the costs of irrigation, fertilization, and planting his crop.

loans.name: Rodney Jesus

texts.es:
Rodney es un hombre de 20 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Camaná con sus padres y hermanos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Rodney pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta pasear por las playas de su ciudad y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimos Lomo Saltado para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Rodeny trabaja como asistente en una empresa comercial de su ciudad, el realiza labores de tramitación, documentación, archivo y otros, Rodney trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Rodney se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea comprar materiales de construcción para tarrajear y ponerle piso de concreto a la sala de su hogar, de esta manera Rodney y su familia tendrán mayor seguridad y bienestar, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para logra su gran sueño de convertirse en un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Rodney is 20 years old, single, and lives in the city of Camana with his parents and siblings.  He is a kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who has a desire to succeed.  Thanks to his efforts and the support of his parents, Rodney was able to study for a professional degree in management.  In his free time he likes to spend time at the beach and sometimes cooks a rich lomo saltado (beef stir-fry) to share with his family.

By his own initiative, with a lot of effort and dedication, Rodney works as an assistant at a business in his city.  He does processing, documentation, archiving, and other tasks.  Rodney works every day for about 10 hours and believes that it is going well because of his good performance and the kind treatment he provides to everyone.

Rodney is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to the support provided he will be able to make repairs to his home.  He wants to purchase construction materials to plaster and put in a concrete floor in the living room of his home.  This will allow Rodney and his family to have better security and well-being.  He will continue working and making an effort to achieve his dream of becoming a good professional.

loans.use: to make improvements to his home.

loans.name: Huong's Group

texts.en:
Huong is 36 years old. She has two children. One of her sons is little, and the other is learning at secondary school. Her husband is a construction worker to earn a living.  He earns about 6,000,000 VND per month. Huong sells fruits, at a market. She earns about 10,000,000 VND per month. She has done this work for ten years. Her family’s total earnings are about 16,000,000 VND per month.

Huong's challenges, in life and work, are a lack of capital to invest in her fruit stall, and the risks of traveling by motorbike when going to work. Her dreams are to build a big house, to have a car in which to carry her goods, and to have more capital to invest in her business. This loan is one of the steps toward achieving Huong's dreams. She can invest in her stock of fruits, to gain more earnings. Huong is a hardworking woman and a passionate businessperson.
 
Huong has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2008. In her latest loan cycle, she borrowed 9,632,000 VND. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND and use it to buy fresh fruits to sell at the market. She always wants to expand her business, raise her children up well, and buy a car.

Other members who are part of Huong's Group include the following:

Sieu is 54 years old. She has two children. She is a farmer. She wants to borrow 9,632,000 VND to breed poultry. 
Chanh is 42 years old. She has two children. She is a construction worker. She wants to borrow 9,632,000 VND to breed pigs.
Hoa is 50 years old. She has two children. She is a seller in a market. She wants to borrow 8,288,000 VND to expand her fruit store.
Lien is 34 years old. She has two children. She is an environmental worker. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to breed poultry.
Xoa is 27 years old. She has two children. She is a seller in a market. She wants to borrow 6,496,000 VND to expand her fruit store.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruits, which she will resell at her market stall

loans.name: Maria Fernanda

texts.es:
Maria es una joven de 19 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Parcona, el cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor. Maria tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante, por ello día a día trabaja como asistente en un despacho de su distrito y con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar con mucho esfuerzo los gastos de sus estudios ya que actualmente cursa la carrera de Derecho; Maria trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y por las noches va a sus clases; ella cree que está saliendo adelante porque le pone muchos esfuerzo y sobre todo porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante y apoyar a su familia.

Maria está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar libros y útiles necesarios para sus estudios, así ella podrá seguir estudiando y trabajando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Obtener su título profesional y tener un estudio de abogados”.
texts.en:
Maria is 19 years old and lives in the Parcona district, which is known for having a warm and inviting climate. Maria is eager to succeed, so she works as an assistant in an office in her district.  With the fruits of her labor, she is able, with a lot of effort, to meet the costs of her studies, since she is currently pursuing a law degree.  Maria works about 9 hours a day and goes to class at night.  She believes she is succeeding because she wants to improve her life and support her family.

Maria is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to the support they provide, she will be able to purchase books and other necessary supplies for her studies.  This will allow her to continue studying and working to make her greatest dream a reality: to obtain her law degree and have a law firm.

loans.use: to purchase books and supplies.

loans.name: Samuel Isaias

texts.es:
Samuel es un hombre de 55 años, vive en la ciudad de Camaná con su esposa y sus hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a sus padres, Samuel no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, en sus ratos libres le gusta ir de pesca con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Lomo Saltado para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Samuel trabaja en su pequeño negocio de pesca y venta de camarones, el trabaja todos los días y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, Samuel se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su experiencia y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Samuel se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea comprar materiales de construcción para hacer el cercado de la parte trasera de su hogar, de esta manera el y su familia tendrá mayor seguridad y bienestar, así pues Samuel seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propio criadero de camarones.
texts.en:
Samuel is 55 years old.  He lives in Camaná with his wife and children.  He loves his family and they are his reason for living.  Samuel is a friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person.   Together, he and his wife dedicate all of their efforts to getting their family ahead.  Regrettably, due to lack of financial resources and the need to start working at a young age to help his parents, Samuel couldn’t study for a professional degree.  In his free time he enjoys going fishing with his family and sometimes cooks the delicious “Lomo Saltado” [beef strip stir fry with rice and fries] to share with his family.
  
By his own initiative, and with much determination and dedication, Samuel works in his small business of catching and selling shrimp.  He works every day and can work for about eight hours.  Samuel feels at ease doing his job and believes that it is going well because of his experience and the kind treatment he offers to others.  

Samuel is very grateful for the Kiva loans because, thanks to their help, he will be able to make improvements to his home.  He wants to purchase construction materials to fence off the back of his home as, in this way, his family will have greater security and well-being.  So, Samuel will continue working and striving to achieve his great dream of having his own shrimp farm.

loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen, a 35-year-old married mother of five children, four of whom are in school, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past five years she has been selling used clothing in the Philippines.

Aileen has requested a PHP 21000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional bundles of used clothing to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional bundles of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Ma. Judea

texts.en:
Ma. Judea is 43 years old, married, and has six children. Five of her children are in school. Ma. Judea works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF. She intends to use the loan to buy items to resell at her store, like shampoo, chips, noodles and soap. Ma. Judea would like to save enough money to provide financial security for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to resell at her store, like shampoo, chips, noodles, and soap

loans.name: Sol Naciente De Pilcopata Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Naciente de Pilcopata” en la ciudad de Pilcopata. 
Noemí tiene 28 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Pilcopata, ella es una persona responsable y amable que sale adelante pues su actividad económica es ayudar a su esposo en la elaboración de muebles de madera como por ejemplo mesas, sillas, roperos, puertas, escritorios, ella se encarga específicamente en el acabado de los muebles entonces en esta oportunidad Noemí requiere el préstamo para comprar madera y materiales de trabajo como pintura, cola de carpintero y entres otros. 

Este banco comunal está conformado por varias personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Los socios se dedican a la agricultura, a la elaboración de muebles, a brindar servicio de transportes, filmación de videos y tomar fotografías.  
Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. 

(La ciudad de Pilcopata está ubicada en el del distrito de Kosñipata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco).
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends formed the Naciente de Pilcopata community bank in the city of Pilcopata.  

Noemí is 28 years old and lives in the city of Pilcopata.  She is a responsible and kind person who is successful.  She works helping her husband make wood furniture such as tables, chairs, wardrobes, doors, and desks.  She is specifically in charge of the finishing of the furniture.  Noemí is requesting this loan to purchase wood and materials such as paint, wood glue, and others.

This community bank is made up of various people who are looking for opportunities to get ahead and give their children a better future with their daily efforts.  The members work as farmers, making furniture, providing transportation services, filming videos, and taking photographs.  The members are grateful for the opportunity provided and promise to make their repayments on the established schedule.

(The city of Pilcopata is located in the district of Kosñipata in the Paucartambo province in the department of Cusco.)

loans.use: to purchase wood and materials such as paint, wood glue, and others.

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es: Gilberto, tiene la edad  de 36 años, está casado, vive con sus hijos y esposa que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de siembra y asistencia para el café, además de comprar algunas plantas de almácigo para hacer siembra nueva y poderla realizar a inicio de lluvias esto con el objetivo de aprovechar lo más que se pueda el periodo de lluvias y así aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Gilberto is 36 years old.  He is married and he lives with his wife and children who are his highest priority.  With his loan he wants to purchase fertilizers, fungicides and pay for labor in the jobs of planting and assisting with the coffee as well as to buy some seedling plants to do a new planting and to be able to carry it out at the start of the rains.  His objective is to take advantage of the rainy season as much as possible and thus to increase the density of plants per area as well as to take advantage of the good fertility of the soil, the climate conditions and other things that favor the cultivation of coffee.  

With these improvements to the crop he hopes to obtain a little profit and thus improve the living conditions of his family, to invest a little more in the area of cultivation and also to achieve some goals.  

It is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He had not had other loans from state banks before but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with greater ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to plant coffee.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raul es soltero y vive en alquiler con su hermano y su mamá en la zona Central de la ciudad de La Paz. Raul requiere el crédito para la compra de un equipo de sonido ya que además de su trabajo regular como empleado de una empresa, atiende un negocio propio de alquiler de instrumentos musicales que le ayuda a su familia con los gastos mensuales.

El sueño de Raul es conseguir una casa propia para su familia y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
Esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito de Impro y de Kiva.
texts.en:
Raul is single and lives with his brother and mother in a rented home in the Central area of the city of La Paz. Raul needs a loan to buy sound equipment as besides his regular job as an employee of a company, he has his own business renting musical instruments which helps his family with the monthly expenses.

Raul’s dream is to buy a home of their own for his family and be able to improve their quality of life.

This is the first time he has applied for a loan from Impro and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy sound equipment to expand his stock of musical instruments that he rents out for extra income

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha es casada y vive junto a su esposo y su hijo en la zona de Chuquiaguillo de la ciudad de La Paz. Vive en casa propia y trabaja en un puesto de hamburguesas por las noches. 
Su esposo sufrió un robo en su negocio del cual nunca se pudo recuperar por lo que ahora ella es la única que mantiene su hogar.

El crédito lo requiere para la compra de insumos al por mayor, como ser carne molida, papas, tomates, aceite, sal, etc., para obtener mejores precios y reducir sus costos y tratar de mejorar sus ingresos.

El sueño de Martha es hacer crecer su negocio y sacar a su familia adelante.
texts.en: Martha is married and lives with her husband and son in the Chuquiaguillo region of La Paz.  She lives in her own home, and works nights at a hamburger stand.  Her husband experienced a robbery at his business and was unable to recover the loss, so now she is the only one that supports the household. She is requesting the loan to purchase wholesale supplies such as ground beef, potatoes, tomatoes, oil, salt, and other items.  In this way, she hopes to obtain better prices, reduce costs, and try to improve her income.  Martha’s dream is grow her business and get her family ahead.

loans.use: to purchase ground beef, potatoes, tomatoes, oil, salt, etc. to continue her business of preparing and selling hamburgers.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Wilfredo, es soltero y tiene un hijo que está en etapa escolar, vive en la casa de su madre ocupando solo una habitación que tiene el piso de tierra, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja por más de ocho horas al día como chófer asalariado, y con todo lo que gana debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos.
El crédito lo requiere para hacer los trámites para la compra de un terreno, ya que con esto podrá  mejorar su calidad de vida y a futuro hacer construir una casa para poder darle seguridad y comodidad a su hijo.
Es la octava vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is single and has a school aged son.  He lives in his mother's house in a room that only has a dirt floor.  The house is located in the Tambladerani area of the city of La Paz.  He works more than eight hours a day as a driver.  He uses his income to cover the costs of food, education, and utilities.

He is requesting this loan to pay for the necessary processes to purchase land since this will allow him to improve his quality of life.  In the future, he can build a house that will give security and comfort to his son.

This is his eighth loan with IMPRO and second with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for the necessary processes to purchase land.

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en:
Although she received no formal education, Adwowa is an entrepreneur. She prepares and sells ‘kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough and wrapped in banana leaves). She can be found selling kenkey in Apewosika (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for one year. Adwowa is married and has five children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her kenkey business normally go towards helping her husband to cover the family’s general expenses and to pay their children’s school fees.

Adwowa will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of maize, which will enable her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adwowa plans to diversify the kinds of products that she sells, thus adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of maize for preparing kenkey to sell

loans.name: Nubia De Los Santos

texts.es:
La Señora Nubia de los Santos, posee un negocio de venta de agua, gaseosas, jugos y cosa de horno ubicado en  la ciudad de León, desde hace trece años, ella realiza esta labor para llevar el sustento a su familia, es madre cuatro  hijos de los cuales solo dos están a su cargo, sale de su casa de habitación a las 6:00 am  abre su negocio a las 7:00 am y finalizando sus labores a las 6:00 pm este trabajo lo realiza  de lunes a sábado en este mismo horario.
 
El  crédito que está solicitando a CEPRODEL lo utilizara  para comprar variedad de gaseosas y jugos, para ofertarles a toda su clientela, y así obtener  mayores ingresos y le permita mejorar su calidad de vida tanto de ella como la de sus cuatro hijos.

Los sueños de la señora Nubia es la preparación de sus  hijos y lograr a tener su propia vivienda  para darle una mejor comodidad.
texts.en:
Nubia de los Santos has a business in the city of León selling water, soft drinks, juice, and corn cakes. She has been doing this work for thirteen years in order to support her family. She is the mother of four children, of whom only two are under her care. She leaves her home at 6:00 am, opens her business at 7:00 am, and finishes her working day at 6:00 pm. She works from Monday to Saturday on this same schedule.

The loan she is asking for from Ceprodel will be used to buy a variety of soft drinks and juices, to offer them to all of her customers. In this way, she will earn better income and improve her quality of life as well as that of her four children.

Nubia's dreams are the education of her children and having her own home to have more comfort.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and various juices.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana  vive en casa alquilada con sus tres hermano menores y sus dos pequeños hijos de 5  y 1 años de edad en la zona de Los Andes de la ciudad de El Alto, trabaja como artesana en costura: confecciona polleras, mismas que las comercializa en la ferias populares de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta es su actividad principal con la que tiene que cubrir la manutención de su familia que está a su cargo.

El crédito que solicita es para la compra de materia prima: tela por rollo para la confección de las polleras; de esta manera mantendrá estable su flujo de ingresos; por la evaluación realizada califica para su aprobación.
 
El sueño de Ana es poder contar con un taller de costura con maquina de  costura industriales y posteriormente tener una tienda donde podrá comercializar su producto.
texts.en:
Ana lives in a rented house with her three younger brothers and her two young children who are 1 and 5 years old in the Los Andes area of the city of El Alto.  She works sewing traditional full skirts, like the ones that are sold at popular markets in the city of El Alto.  This is her main source of income, which she uses to support the family that is in her care.

She is requesting this loan to purchase materials: bolts of fabric to make skirts.  This will allow her to maintain a stable flow of income.  She qualified for approval based on an evaluation.

Ana's dream is to have a sewing workshop with industrial sewing machines and later to have a shop where she can sell her products.

loans.use: to purchase bolts of different colored fabrics for her business making skirts.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es:
Nieves vive en casa de su familia, en la zona de san Simón de la ciudad de La Paz, trabaja como promotora en una funeraria y llena el formulario Davinci (utilizado para el pago de impuestos al valor agregado) para algunos clientes, con esta actividad se mantiene y mantiene a su familia 

El crédito que solicita es para capital de arranque ya que ella tenía antes un negocio de venta de víveres (arroz, azúcar, fideos) el cual quiere reactivar para mejorar sus ingresos. Nieves desea comprar al por mayor y ofrecer a sus clientes.

El sueño de Nieves es poder tener un almacén de ventas de sus productos  y poder darles una buena educación a sus hijos ya que el esposo la abandonó.
texts.en:
Nieves lives in the home of her family in La Paz’s San Simón zone. She works as a functionary in a funeral home and fills in Davinci forms (used for the payment of value added taxes) for some clients. She maintains herself and her family with this activity.

The loan that she is requesting is for startup capital as she used to have a grocery store (rice, sugar, noodles) which she wants to reopen in order to improve her income. Nieves wants to buy at wholesale and make sales to her customers.

Nieves’s dream is to have a general store for her products and to give her children a good education as her husband abandoned her.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, and sugar in order to reopen her grocery store to improve her income.

loans.name: Sr De Coyllority Cachimayo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SR DE COYLLORITY CACHIMAYO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cachimayo, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Bernardina ella es soltera y tiene 55 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de verduras y frutas, la socia vende manzanas,naranjas,uvas,platanos y mandarinas, la socia también vende zanahorias, tomates y pepinos, la socia tiene un puesto de mercado donde vende las frutas y verduras, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las frutas y verduras. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar naranjas,platanos,uvas,cebollas,zanahorias y pepinos.
Las socias que estan pegadas a la foto grupal se les tomo despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de chompas, negocio de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The Senor de Coyllority Cachimayo community bank is located in the Cachimayo district in the Anta province and department of Cusco.

Bernadina is a member of the group.  She is 55 years old, single, and has two children.  She works selling fruits and vegetables.  She sells apples, oranges, grapes, bananas, and mandarin oranges as well as carrots, tomatoes, and cucumbers.  She has a market stall where she sells the produce.  She works from 8:00am until 5:00pm.  She has had this business for seven years and it is going very well.  Her dream is to have a store where she can sell fruits and vegetables.  She is requesting a loan to purchase oranges, bananas, grapes, onions, carrots, and cucumbers.  

The members who are attached to the group photo had their photo taken after the meeting because they missed it due to work.  The other group members work selling sweaters, clothing, at a grocery store, and selling food.

Bernadina is grateful to everyone who is a part of this dream and promises to make her repayments on the established schedule.

loans.use: to purchase oranges, bananas, grapes, onions, carrots, and cucumbers.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El cliente vive en La Libertad, tiene un negocio de venta de zapatos. El poco a poco ha progresado ya que tiene una discapacidad que no puede movilizare y esta en una silla que la conduce con los brazos ya que esta silla tiene palancas de bicicleta. Trabaja todos los dias desde las 07:00am hasta las 18:00pm, su sobrino le ayuda en vendiendo los zapatos.

El tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere mejorar los zapatos que vende. Y comprar con el préstamo zapatos deportivos y formales. Su sueño es tener un local propio.
texts.en:
The client lives in La Libertad, and he has a business selling shoes.  Little by little, he has progressed.  He has a disability, and he is not ambulatory.  He is in a chair that he manages with his arms.  The chair has bicycle gears.  He works every day from 7:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  His nephew helps him sell the shoes.

He has a lot of aspirations for his business.  Therefore, he wants to improve the shoes that he sells.  He will use the loan to buy athletic shoes and formal shoes.  His dream is to have his own place.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances Abena did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Abena sells fish  in Apewosika (near Cape Coast). She has been doing this for about 9 years. As a divorcee with 5 children, Abena uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Abena will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of fish, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Abena wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of fish, which will aid her in improving her overall sales

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is divorced and has 5 children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Efua is a successful businesswoman. She prepares and sells ‘Banku’ for a living (a traditional Ghanaian dish made using fermented corn/cassava dough that is mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth whitish consistent paste). She normally sells her ‘Banku’ in Apewosika (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about 8 years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Efua uses her income to provide for the entire family. Efua will use the loan to purchase large amounts of maize and cassava, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase large amounts of maize and cassava

loans.name: Samon

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Samon is 32 years old and married. She has three children, all of whom are dependents and still in school. To support the big family, she and her husband have been raising pigs for six years. The current business earns her family about 40,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs.
 
This is the first microloan for Samon with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR to buy pig feed to nourish her pigs and use a portion of it to spend on building a piggery. She hopes to fatten her pigs and sell them for a good price to improve her family’s living condition and keep their children in school.

loans.use: to buy pig feed to nourish her pigs

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Erlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a pillow making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from candy making.  Erlinda is borrowing 23,000 PHP through NWTF to buy sacks of cotton and fabric for her pillow making business.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of cotton and fabric for her business

loans.name: Marcosa

texts.en:
Marcosa is 41 years old, married and has five children. With three children currently in school, Marcosa works very hard to provide for them.

Marcosa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Marcosa has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as laundry soap, biscuits, candies, noodles, sugar, etc. 

In the future, Marcosa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Nov

texts.en:
Nov is a 29-year-old married woman residing in a small village of Prey Chor district, Kommpong Cham. She is a very kind, hardworking woman who wants to get ahead in her business and is eager to provide a better quality of life to her three children, who are currently attending school. Having worked in the farming business for more than 20 years, Nov and her spouse are able to make a net profit of 10,000 KHR per day.

Nov has never done business with any state banks before and she’s very grateful to be granted a loan through HKL branch office. She has mentioned that only HKL can provide her a much lower interest rate and a long term payment plan. The loan amounting to $1,000 US dollars will allow her to buy a motorcycle which is very useful for the family to get from one place to another especially to a far distant area without any payments to motor taxi service. In this way, Nov will save a bit on transportation and can use it for the future for any family emergency.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances Ama did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Ama sells bread in Apewosika (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about 6 years. She is married to a farmer, and together they have 5 children. Ama uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Ama will use the loan to purchase a large amount of bread, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Ama wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of bread, which will aid her in improving her overall sales

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 48 years old, married, and has seven children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Thelma is borrowing 29,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Thelma has been pig fattening for 28 years and also earns additional income from fishing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Florence is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling yams in Apewosika (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 2 years. Florence is married and has 4 children. Her husband works as a driver. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Florence wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of yams. In the long term, Florence plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase inventory allowing her to sell greater quantities of yams

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances Adwowa did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Adwowa sells charcoal in Apewosika (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about 3 years. She is married to a farmer, and together they have 4 children. Adwowa uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Adwowa will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of charcoal, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Adwowa wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of charcoal

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel, de 46 años es una mujer alegre. Vive en compañía de su esposo Ambrosio y sus 5 hijos, todos ellos estudiantes. Juntos viven en la casa que compraron desde hace 12 años.Desde hace  más de 15 años  se dedica a las labores agrícolas  en sus terrenos de cultivo donde siembra alfalfa que le sirve de alimento para sus animales así como también para venta. Sus labores lo realizan gracias al apoyo de su esposo e hijos. Todos los días vende sus sembríos a las diferentes ciudades del país, “mis principales compradores son los comerciantes de los diferentes mercados de la ciudad donde vivo”, afirma. Comenta que en este mes le fue muy bien en el negocio, obtuvo buenas ganancias, por esa razón desea seguir sembrando. Comenta que ahora tiene cultivos de alverja, habas, maíz y demás hortalizas que muy pronto cosechará y mandará a la capital del país, pues es ahí donde tiene mayores compradores.Este es el tercer crédito con KIVA, se siente feliz pues en este tiempo logró obtener muchas ganancias y todo gracias al apoyo económico que le brindan. Por ello promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual .Isabel, invertirá los S/.3500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para mejorar sus sembríos.
texts.en: Isabel is 46 years old and is a cheerful person. She lives with her husband Ambrosio and their 5 children. They live together in the house they bought 12 years ago. For more than 15 years she has worked in agriculture on her crop land where she plants alfalfa, which she uses to feed her animals and also sells. She is able to do her work thanks to the support of her husband and children. Every day she sells her crops in the different cities of the country. “My main buyers are merchants from the different markets in the city where I live,” she explains. She says that this month business went very well for her, she had good earnings. For this reason, she wants to continue planting. She explains that the crops she now has are peas, fava beans, corn, and other vegetables, which she will soon harvest and send to the capital of the country, since that is where she has more buyers. This is her third loan with Kiva. She feels happy because in this time she has had a lot of earnings and it is all thanks to the economic support they provide. She pledges to complete her repayments in a punctual manner. Isabel will use the 3,500.00 PEN (Peruvian nuevos soles) to buy organic manure to improve her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 52 years old and has eight children. Myrna is married and five of her children are in school.

Myrna is in the agricultural business of hog raising in the Philippines. Myrna requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Myrna has been in hog raising for 6 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Myrna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Shareefa

texts.en:
Shareefa is a hardworking housewife. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband is a shoemaker by profession. Shareefa is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of improving her husband's business. Her husband will use the loan amount to purchase rexine, leather, and glue for making shoes.

With the profits expected from this loan. He intends to expand his business so that he can eventually construct a small house for his family. Shareefa hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase rexine, leather, and glue for making shoes.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Agnes is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling maize in Apewosika (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 2 years. Agnes is married and has 2 children. Her husband works as a driver. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Agnes will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of maize, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Agnes plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase large amounts of maize

loans.name: Pegie

texts.en:
Pegie is 32 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She has run a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines for three years and earns additional income raising pigs. 

Pegie has borrowed and paid seven loans from the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation.  She has requested this loan of 24,000 Philippine pesos to buy additional sacks of charcoal.

Pegie aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Jessel

texts.en: Jessel is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 38 years old, is married and has 3 children. Jessel operates a specialized retail store as a source of income. For 6 years, Jessel has been running this store and earns 5,000 PHP monthly.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 6,000 PHP to purchase additional goods for sale. Jessel hopes to get adequate income from this investment so she can sustain her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods for sale

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Margaret is an entrepreneur. She works as a petty trader in Apewosika (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 1 year. Margaret is married and has 3 children. Her husband works as a teacher. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Margaret wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of biscuits, groundnuts, and gari. In the long term, Margaret plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase inventory to sell greater quantities of biscuits, groundnuts, and gari

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is divorced and has three children. Even though she did not receive a formal education, Aba is a successful businesswoman. She sells cooked rice in Apewosika (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about seven years. 

As the sole breadwinner, Aba uses her income to provide for the entire family. She will use this loan to purchase more rice, which will help her improve her overall sales. 

With profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to diversify the types of products she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase more rice to improve her sales

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es:
Marilu continúa viviendo en la ciudad de Gamitana y con el negocio de compra y venta de madera, ella es una persona responsable y amable  que sale adelante y su actividad económica complementaria es ayudar  a su esposo con la elaboración de muebles de madera como por ejemplo mesas, sillas, roperos, carpetas y en esta oportunidad requieren el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo madera, cola de carpintero, lijar y otras cosas más. Marilu continúa perteneciendo al banco comunal “Nuevo Amanecer de Gamitana”. 

Marilu nació en la comunidad de Gamitana (Este pueblo se localiza en el distrito de Las Piedras, provincia de Tambopata y departamento de Madre De Dios, Perú.),
texts.en: Marliu continues living in the city of Gamitana and working with her business of buying and selling lumber. She is a responsible and friendly person. She gets ahead in life and her complementary economic activity is helping her husband make wooden furniture such as, for example, tables, chairs, armoires, and desks. At this time they need a loan to buy materials for their work, such as wood, carpenter’s glue, sand paper, and other things. Marilu continues participating in the “Nuevo Amanecer de Gamitana” communal bank. Marilu was born in the community of Gamitana. (This town is located in the district of Las Piedras, in the province of Tambopata, in the department of Madre de Dios, Peru.)

loans.use: to buy materials such as wood, carpenter’s glue, sand paper, and other things.

location.town: Gamitana - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Pam

texts.en:
Pam is 46 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She has four children, two of which are dependent. Rice farming and cassava growing are the primary sources of her family’s income and she has been in this business for 21 years. With the current business, she can earn approximately 41,000 KHR per day and save about 23,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

This is the second micro loan for Pam with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She fully paid back the past loan which have helped her to better support her family with sufficient food. Now she is requesting for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR to buy pesticide for her cultivation and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees in plowing the field. She hopes to increase her current business so as to earn a larger income to make their living better.

loans.use: to buy pesticide for her cultivation

loans.name: Pildausa Ruth

texts.en:
Pildausa Ruth works hard to support her family. Pildausa Ruth is married and has a buy and sell accessories business in the Philippines.

Pildausa Ruth requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional accessories to sell.

Pildausa Ruth has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Pildausa Ruth would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional accessories to sell

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina works hard to support her family. Rosalina is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Rosalina requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Rosalina has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Rosalina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Nary

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Nary is 20 years, married and has one son who is still small. To make a living and support her family, Nary and her husband have been farming rice and pineapple as a primary business. The current business earns her family about US $10 per day to meet the family’s need.  
 
This is the third micro loan for Nary with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She completely paid back the past loans which have helped her improve her family’s livelihood. Now she is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to cultivate her rice and pineapples to earn more income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda works hard to support her family. Rosalinda is married and has a hog raising business in the Philippines.

Rosalinda requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 8 years now.

Rosalinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Miguel ángel vive en la cuida de Managua trabaja en una institución del estado desde hace 9 años casado hacer su mayor esfuerzo para sacar adelante su familia.

Miguel está haciendo la solicitud de su crédito para solventar  pagos de universidad.
Agradeciendo mucho a los inversionistas de kiva porque gracias  a los crédito obtenidos ha ido mejorando sus condiciones de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel lives in the cityof Managua. He has been working for a state institution for the past 9 years. He is married and works hard to support his family.

Miguel is requesting a loan to make payments for university classes.

He is grateful to the Kiva lenders because it is thanks to the loans he has obtained that that he has been improving his family's quality of life.

loans.use: pay for university expenses.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is a 44-year-old married woman from Talibon,Bohol. She has 2 children ages 4 and 8 respectively. She's involved in fishing. She sells fish, crabs and sea shells to customers in the community. Her husband is a fisherman. She sells her husband's catch to earn a living. 

She requested a loan of 14,000 PHP to buy a crab cage, paint and rice. In the future, Dina would like to expand her fishing business to provide her family with good food and to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy a crab cage, paint and rice

loans.name: Kunduzkhon

texts.en:
As a married parent of 3 children, Kunduzkhon works hard to support her family. She has a clothes sales business in the Tajikistan.  She has had this business for 18 years and in this way she earns money for a living. 

Kunduzkhon has been sustaining her business activities through her past loans from Imon International organization. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money. In the future, she hopes to improve her business in order to provide good living conditions for the family. 

Kunduzkhon is asking for a loan of $1,200 USD to buy women and children's clothes for the new season. In order to make her house safer and improve her standard of living, she will continue working and fighting to make her biggest dream come true: “TO BE A SUCCESSFUL BUSINESS LADY.”

loans.use: to buy women and children's clothes for the new season

loans.name: Nicanora

texts.en:
Nicanora is a 55-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has 3 children ages 22, 23 and 25 years old respectively. She raises hogs. She has been raising hogs for more than 10 years now. Aside from hog raising, Nicanora also sells fresh eggs to customers as an additional income.
